oai_dc:dc.dc:title: State of the art of the project “innovative Public Organic food Procurement for Youth” (iPOPY)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Løes, Anne-Kristin
Noelting, Benjamin
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Markets and trade
Processing, packaging and transportation
Produce chain management
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The paper is part of the proceedings of an iPOPY seminar. The authors give an overview of the iPOPY project and its first results. This outline of the holistic research approach helps locate the challenges of the supply side of public organic food procurement for youth.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: International Centre for Research in Organic Food Systems (ICROFS)
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Løes, Anne-Kristin and Noelting, Benjamin (2009) State of the art of the project “innovative Public Organic food Procurement for Youth” (iPOPY). In: Noelting, Benjamin (Ed.) Providing organic school food for youths in Europe - Policy strategies, certification and supply chain management in Denmark, Finland, Italy and Norway. Proceedings of the iPOPY seminar held at the BioFach February 20th 2009 in Nuremberg, Germany, International Centre for Research in Organic Food Systems (ICROFS), CORE Organic Series Report, pp. 9-13.
